column4: Magn3ts, I wonder if apt was stripping the architecture flag?
And that's why dpkg worked?
probably, I don't know what form it expects. I should look it up.
just fyi, chrome has built in noscript basically.
no it has that too.
the browser can touch things that the user id the process is running as has access to
the browser can, but not flash content.
if there's an exploit it can, but it still can't install software on the local machine without an additional esclation exploit, which I've never ever ever seen in a linux systme, ever.
again, only through an exploit or flash.
I think he's just confused about interactive webapps, flash content, plugins, and true local applications.
is right... firefox will always list the installed extensions
don't forget disable unnecessary services....
do you disable much out of the box? There's no ssh by default in the desktop version ,etc.
for like video?
there's some howtos to do an ssh tunnel for vnc
oh it's okay, I use NX now. I think I was just playing with Android stuff... although I suppose since I'm rooted I could still do ssh+Vnc on my phone, but I'll just leave it off for now.
yes, I tried that angle, didn't help
I just got done talking with him
I think I'm a sucker.
yeah.

he tried PMing me a bit, but after he tried to get me to re-assure him that running a windows cracking program was safe I said. "1) no to illegal stuff, and 2) you can never be sure that cracks are safe"
